I thought that Hyde/Jekyll resembled the same one from League of Extraordinary Gentlemen, but if you ever read the book, they both went by the description in the book, which I thought was good.  Hope everyone enjoys the movie as much as I did!!!!

Being THE BIGGEST vampire & Dracula fan EVER i couldn't wait to see this film - was i disappointed? NO WAY! This is my favourite film this year! It's also my dream film come true - having two of my favourite actors playing the lead roles. Richard Roxburgh (Dracula) & the eva gorgeous Hugh Jackman (Van Helsing) fighting against each other is just great! I've already seen it four times since it's release & will be seeing it again soon! I would recommend this to any Dracula fan, especially of the old classic Hammer Horrors of yester year as it pays good homage to them as well as to modern day horrors! It has laughs, scares & emotional parts it equal amounts. Go c this film NOW!

Review title: Switch off the movie snob within and enjoy
Review_body: Having read so many negative views it was with some trepidation that I took my nephew along to see the movie. I was however, pleasantly surprised to be thoroughly entertained.  I don't know what some folks were expecting with this film, but I was only looking to be entertained, and entertained I certainly was.  This is escapist stuff not an art house movie.  Sure some of the dialogue could be better and a bit more could be done on character development.  The CGI could also have been improved, Mr Hyde anyone? But overall its fabulous fun. The action is pretty much non-stop and the film is visually stunning for the most part. Okay so there's no deep meaningful plot. So what? Can anyone tell me what the great plot was in "Lost in Translation"?  I still enjoyed that film too, but it never got slaughtered like Van Helsing. If you're looking for some arty movie with depth and substance, save your money.  However, if you're simply looking to be entertained, go see the movie, switch off the movie snob within, sit back and enjoy.

Wow, let me tell you, Van Helsing has got to be the most action-packed thrill ride I have ever seen! I absolutely loved Steven Sommer's The Mummy and the Mummy Returns, because the action, plot, and even hints of comedy made the movie extremely fun. Actually, I was skeptical about Van Helsing when I first saw the preview. It looked like another monster movie that jams too much into it, with nothing exciting and fresh about it. I was doubtful that one movie could have all these famous monsters, and have them make a classic movie. I was wrong! This movie was awesome! Combined with the best special effects I have seen since LOTR, a cool and interesting plot line, and even cooler characters, Van Helsing is a must-see movie this May. I especially liked Anna Valerious, and her "I dont need any help" attitude. Trying to grab and throw any weapon available at her nemesis, Dracula, was something that made me laugh. It reminds me of The Mummy Returns when Evie is trying to drag a bench in front of the museum doors to block the dead warriors from getting to them, and Rick says "Honey, what are you doing? These guys don't use doors!" And the warriors bust out of the walls, frightening them both. I hope this was even the littlest bit helpful on deciding to see the movie, because I know I'm going to see it over and over!

Review title: Two Thumbs up for Van Helsing!
Review_body: Van Helsing is one of the best movies I saw all year.I am a major Hugh Jackman fan.I saw almost all his movies.The whole Van Helsing movie was great.I already have the soundtrack:).My favorite part is when this one dude goes,"I see the Wolfman hasn't killed you yet." then Hugh goes,"Don't worry he's getting to it." That is just so hilarius. I saw twice already even though it is now Sunday and it came out on Friday I saw it Saturday and today afternoon.It is so good.My friend Annie who I saw it with twice she kept saying Sexy Body to Hugh Jackman(Whispering it though).So if you haven't seen Van Helsing see it it is way good.Two thumbs up Hugh.

First off, let me say that I am a HUGE fan of the early Universal horror movies. These movies created the genre. My understanding was that Van Helsing was a modern, CGI-heavy homage to those early movies. The movie even begins where the Son Of Frankenstein left off. Except for the stellar perfomance of Karloff in The Mummy and the first 2 Frankenstein movies, almost all of the rest of the early Universal Dracula/Frankenstein/Wolfman movies were fun (and sometimes silly) popcorn movies. True, there was not a lot of room in this movie for deep acting and the story might even be considered campy, but that's ok. It was a fun addition to the Universal horror tradition.  I liked Jackman's Van Helsing character and David Wenham was great. There were a few questionable bits of dialog, a bad accent here and there, some borderline CG, etc, etc...but I enjoyed the movie a great deal.

Basically this film is pretty much like The Mummy. Some plots don't make too much sense, pure entertainment.They try to make this another Indiana Jones movie. You can see something in it. Hugh definitely has the charm to put the role out. However, the story is a little bit weak. I'm also a big fan of Indy, if they are going to find someone to play Indy in the future, I would love to see Hugh as Indy.He could be funny, tough, and charming, very talented actor.

Review title: my hopes dropped like Igor (off a bridge, cliché style)
Review_body: Wow. Please, don't see this movie. Honestly, i went in with such high hopes... my girlfriend for a week went around work saying "your reputation precedes you". Because it was funny. But in all honesty there's no better example of the concept of "Overdoing it" than VH. Overacted. Overactioned. Over-clichéd... one after another after another. Too many plot-saving miracles - catching a tossed antidote while swinging wildly from a distant tower during a severe lightning storm just one example. I really liked frankenstien - he was a really likeable character, a nice guy, brave, and interestingly mechanical. And i think "some things are better left forgot" is the worst cinematic cop-out in history. If you like irritatingly accent-crippled flat characters that can fly and unhinge their jaws, this is the movie for you. if you have any decent taste, beware.

I LOVE Hugh Jackman so I really couldn't wait to go see this one!The movie wasn't bad. It was pretty exciting...although there just wasn't much in the way of a storyline. There were all sorts of cool monsters in this flick and I have to say, I really LIKED Dracula! I don't understand why everyone is slamming him and Kate's accent. I think the entire ensemble did a great job. Also...for the person who mentioned Anne Rice rolling over in her grave....SHE'S STILL ALIVE! Worth a rental and a matinee...don't pay full price.

Review title: AWESOME MOVIE-DON'T LISTEN TO THE REVIEWS OR THE RATINGS!
Review_body: I saw this movie last weekend, and I must say that I simply LOVED it.  I think that a lot of people were expecting TOO much from it, and they read too much into it.  This is one of those movies that you just go see to enjoy.  You go to relax, not think.  It is very enjoyable, and its NON-STOP action.  you are SERIOUSLY on the edge of your seat for the entire duration of the movie.  It REALLY doesn't seem like a 2 1/2 hour movie.  It can be predictable in some parts, but the graphics and animation are EXCELLENT. They really did a GREAT job!  There are a few different places that will surprise you.  Don't listen to the REVIEWS, go see it and DECIDE for yourself.  It is an AWESOME way to kick off the summer movie season!  One more thing, try not too blink too much during this movie-if you blink you WILL MISS SOMETHING.

Review title: Loads of fun, if you don't take it too seriously.
Review_body: I read lots of bad reviews for this, so I went in not expecting much. Boy, was I surprised. This was no masterpiece, but it was just as fun for me as Sommers' first Mummy movie was. I didn't mind that the special effects weren't seamless. The sometimes cheesy effects, acting, and plot just added to the overall experience. The only thing that would have made this a better movie for me is if Jack Burton was the main character and this was a sequal to Big Trouble in Little China. The Frankenstein monster sold it for me with his perfect blend of intelligence, compassion, and humanity. His soulful character almost made this the perfect movie.Oh, and Kate Beckinsale in tight leather pants doesn't hurt, in any case.

You're going to read a lot of reviews saying how bad this movie is...You're going to read A LOT OF THEM, because it's TRUE. This movie just does not know when enough is enough. Overkill. Overdone. Too much of a bad thing. All style, and zero substance. Are all phrases I would use to describe this way too expensive movie, that had some promise. I will give the director this: the visuals in this movie are amazing. I will admit that the music was solid. But when action scenes, become layered on top of action scenes, which become layered on top of two or three more actions scenes, all at the same time, there is too much going on (Learn from Spielberg in Indiana Jones and learn that much of a good thing is good, but also learn from Godzilla that too much of a bad thing is bad!). Not enough in this movie to make me want to care. If you are going to focus on several characters, make me care. Yes the person I was with jumped a few times, and at times there were very creative thoughts mixed in with a whole lot of crap. The whole baby spawn of dracula was such a bad idea. Van Helsing is a regal character deserving of a regal movie. This is just the REGAL BEAGLE with special effects and Larry is still a poor man's Jack Tripper...;)

OK Folks I am very tired of people ripping on this movie. I'll be honest it does have its sappy moments. However, it does not deserve the flames it has been getting. First off the choice to use black and white for the first few minuets is strongly trying to tell the viewer that you are going back to a time in Hollywood's history were what we have come to expect will not apply here. This movie is his chance to show us that vision. In addition the man can't let his humor not shine through every chance he gets. Review title: I THOUGHT this movie looked cool
Review_body: I was looking forward to seeing this movie when i saw the trailer. I went to see it the other day with my mate and it was so damn corny. i mean at the end when they are at castle dracula, how in hell can you swing on a wire one handed so much? Review title: To suck, or not to suck...
Review_body: No matter what any one says, I think that Van Helsing is the best film with its content (such as horror) since The Mummy, and, The Mummy Returns.The CGI graphics are produced really well and the actors played their parts magnificently. Castle Frankinstein is in Geneva, and not in Transylvania. But that does not bring the story line down, and, makes the film entertaining. I did jump out of my seat a few times because all of the monsters jumped out the shadows when you least expected it!

If you have extra 9 euros and 2.15 hours to spend and can't think of anything else to do, give the money to a next person passing by. That way you can at least do something useful with your time...This film includes a horse carriage that catches fire from contact with werewolf and explodes on collision!It's totally mindless mix of classic horror characters brought alive with CGI action that defies all physics and physiology. It's supposed to be a horror film but at least to me it was a comedy, of the unintentional kind.  If you go see it, you get the most out of it by trying to catch all references to other movies.

I don't know what people have against this movie.  First off, critics always hate movies that turn out to be good or enjoyable, it's just a fact.  So I never listen to movie critics, I only go off of what my friends tell me about stuff.  But I seriously loved this movie.  Same thing happened with The Punisher, terrible reviews but I thought it was awesome.  Anyways, I'm not going to summarize the entire movie, just some characters.  Hugh Jackman (whom I love as an actor) as Van Helsing is awesome.  I read reviews comparing him to Harrison Ford as Indiana Jones and saying that he wasn't as memorable.  That's just plain dumb, because it wasn't until after at least the 2nd Indiana Jones movie that people found Indiana Jones to be a one of a kind character.  Anyways, I thought he did a great job, and he brought a lot of fun and excitement to the screen.  David Wenham as Carl was great, he was awesome as Faramir in the Lord of the Rings, and he was great in Van Helsing.  He provides some comic relief as Carl, and I loved it.  Now for my favorite part: Kate Beckinsale.  Ok, to begin with Kate Beckinsale is pretty easily one of the most gorgeous women I've ever seen between those I've met/seen in real life and in movies and television.  But in this movie in particular, everything about her makes me drool.  The outfit, the hair, the make up, and especially the accent, all just, wow.  I seriously cannot stop thinking of it.  But anyways, even though she'll likely receive little to no credit for her role as Anna Valerious, she did an incredible job. Anyways, I've seen this twice now, and I still love it.  So for those of you who are looking to see a fun and enjoyable movie, see this one.  If you're looking for a George Lucas or Peter Jackson masterpiece, you're going to be disappointed.  But this movie serves it's purpose in my mind.

I must admit I didn't know what or who Van Helsinger was about before I went to see the film. A moden twist to 3 horror villains and one of them ends up being a good guy - for a change! Extreme special effects were an added bonus to an in-depth tale and at times quite funny. Hugh Jackman was an excellent "slayer" with fantastic 007 style weapons. Makes you wonder if Van Helsinger also drank a dry martini - SHAKEN not stirred!!! It's been such a long time since I actually jumped in my seat at the cinema and there were a few occasions. There could be a possibility for a sequel!? Everyone has their own opinion but for me this was an excellent film definitely along the same lines as Bram Stokers Dracula/Raiders of the Lost Ark.

I loved the movie, I would go and watch it everyday if I could.  I think that this is one of the best Thriller movies of its time.  I also think it is one of the best Vampire/Slayer movies also.... LOVED IT!  I also think that if you really watched it close you would also see what it is in the movies that makes kids act like they do.  It isn't the movies, but it is close.  I believe this is a great movie, but it should only be viewed by older children and adults.  Ages 13 and up like the ratings says.  Also, if you actually watched real close you would see the special affects that made this movie great!  So from my eyes it is a Vampire vs. Slayer movie, involving Count Dracula and Dr. Van Helsing.

If you're looking for a good way to spend 2 hours, go see this movie. Sure, Frankenstein isn't how you remember him from other movies, but he is how he's supposed to be in the book, more or less.  Hollywood has done a lot of damage to the Monster, and now it's time for a more accurate portrayal of Mary Shelley's creation. Hugh Jackman does a good job NOT playing Wolverine, and Kate Beckinsale does Romanian with the best of them.  This is from the guy who brought us "The Mummy" so expect some camp along with your action/adventure.  As someone who has read both "Dracula" and "Frankenstein," I was not disappointed by the way the movie turned out.

Review title: Good Acting, Good Plot, Good Music (SPOILER!!!)
Review_body: 'Van Helsing' is one of the most interesting movies I've seen in a long time. I'm pretty picky in my movie viewing, so I don't go out to the theater very often. The plot lines, musical scores and delicious acting is what makes this one of my top choices of films. There are a lot of unexpected twist and turns (the Angel Gabriel turning into a werewolf?) that even made me nod my head and applaud. I think what I loved most about this film(not the graphics.... they were well, good. at best. I'm no longer impressed with Computer Generated Imagery or C.G.I. for short) is the superb acting by the cast. The first bit of credit goes to David Wenham. It took me about 10 minutes of his acting to actually realize that this was the same person that played one of my favorite characters in the Lord of The Rings. His quirky comic relief was commendable. I think my favorite actor was the one who played Dracula. He seemed to envelope the role as his own (as a good actor should).I cannot express my adoration of the musical score of this film. For me, the score of a film is an important part on how the audience reacts, whether or not they notice it. Keeping up with the action on screen, this adds a definite gothic feel to the movie. My favorite element of this score was the chanting. I will definitely have to add it to my soundtrack collection.Granted, the whole werewolf thing was a LITTLE cheesy (I can see the headlines now:"Wolverine Turns Werewolf in this Action/Adventure!") but it can be forgiven.All in all, this was a good movie. If a good mix of thrills, laughs and a new twist on some old stories is what you're looking for, this film is definitely it.

Review title: Why isn't there a zero in the voting drop down box?
Review_body: I had heard that Van Helsing had 38% on Rotten Tomatoes however I prefer to make up my own mind...so unfortunately I decided to go see the movie. Having just seen it (less than 30 minutes ago), I can tell you that I am struggling to think of a worse movie than this one.  Ok ok so maybe Blood Moon comes close (that REALLY bad Australian horror movie that sent me walking after only 30 minutes...)...  Actually the reality is I haven't seen a $150 million dollar movie made worse than this.....  This takes the cake. Bad accents, bad acting, relatively ok CGI but chronically noticeable CGI all the same...awful awful awful.  Admittedly Hugh Jackman was ok, but my god the rest of it is atrocious.  I have committed to memory the name of the writer/director aswell as Richard Roxburgh and a host of others so that whenever I see a movie featuring their names again I will NOT waste my time, energy, and hard earned money.  Beauty is truly in the eye of the beholder as is evidenced by 13% of votes here giving it 10 out of 10.  However stupidity is also in the hands of the beholder as I'm sure 10 might easily be mistaken as 1 in a drop down box....oops, my girlfriend just informed me Rotten Tomatoes has reduced the % to 25.....and falling...I don't drink alot of alcohol but right now bourbon is my only release from the grip of being Halsified....sorry if I'm offending anyone but geez, what can I do, I've just spent the last 2 hours in hell-sing.......

Saw "Helzing" yesterday morning (11 AM).  Saw it in digital projection but was disappointed that it was not widescreen. Great projecton clarity.. and wondrous sound from the thrilling soundtrack!I think it is one of the greatest thrill rides I've ever been on. It sure beats the hell out of Space Mountain!! Caught myself saying "WOW" several times.. outloud!! Can't remember having that ever happen before and I'm a film buff... (Although it may have happened in "2001 A Space Oddessy".. at the beginning.. when the ape throws the bone in the air..and the scene changes to outer space with the Strauss waltz music and beautiful revolving spaceship.)

Huge Hugh Jackman fan, I have to say that first.  Why did the movie have to stink?  The film was obnoxiously melodramatic (ex. Beckinsale's hair tosses and running sequences were annoying).  I sometimes found it hard to understand what Dracula was saying.  His brides were absurd; posturing, screeching and moaning excessantly.  The special effects were amazing, however dizzying.  The film did pay homage to the horror films of old: the opening scenes featuring the creation of Frankenstein's monster shot in black and white.  Although most of the film was well, "over the top". Hugh, however, did the best he could with what he had before him.  I would recommend the film to Hugh Jackman fans, for everyone else; wait for the DVD.

I know some people believe that this movie wasn't really good, but I disagree. The movie was a great mix of action, suspense, and humor. For those that believed that some scenes were a little campy, it should be reminded that they were trying to bring back some of the old horror movie experience (as shown with the black and white scene) and not bring everything in all new. The special effects were great and the movie also brought new twists to the characters while mostly keeping their traditional roles. Also the "friar" brought in humor at just the right times to create a great balance of content. I recommend this movie to everyone who likes this genre. It really is lots of fun.

I freely admit that Van Helsing is not as good as Pirates of the Caribbean, but I maintain that it IS good in the same WAY as Pirates of the Caribbean, which is to say that it's a fun roller-coaster of a movie with a Weird Tales twist.The best way to enjoy this movie is to pretend that it's anime rather than live action; I think the presence of live actors seems to have fooled too many people into thinking that it's a movie you're supposed to somehow take seriously. It's not. It's a movie you're supposed to grin and laugh and go "Now THAT'S a neat image!" at.Chew the scenery! Swing from the wires! Blast a bazillion bolts out of the gatling crossbow! And look great doing it. That's what I call a terrific summer movie. :)

I thought the movie was great,great plot, good amount of action, great acting, great characters and great Animation. My favorite characters were the 3 werewolves they were well animated. my favorite scene in the film is where Van helsing turns into a warewolf and kills Dracula. they're are many classical monsters in this film such as Dracula,Dr. jeckle(mr. hyde), werewolves, and freinkenstein. This film will make you jump out of your seat plenty of times. it really is like a roller-coaster ride. Hugh jackman, kate Beckinsale and Richard Roxburgh were great actors in this movie. I give this movie a 10 because it is a great thriller film and will be one of my favorites of all time.

OK, when watching this movie keep in mind that you just set there numb to the brain, have no conscience ....and you might ac utally like it. For having a budget of 160 million this movie should defiantly had been better, it introduced nothing new to the table, it was just an all out visual f/x ride. The studios should start giving a fraction of that budget to people who actually know how to make movies, instead of someone who will just recreate the same material and slap 100 million effects on it. The script for this must have been horrible, thats why it had so big of a budget , they thought they could get away with piling more money on it to solve there problems. This could possibly be the third worst movie I've seen, just ahead of Tango and Cash and Nothing But Trouble. A couple of early lines make you think that it might be a send-up of the horror genre, a la Kill Bill, but that soon devolves into an orgy of CGI and poorly written dialogue. The only amusing performance in the movie is turned in by David Wenham, playing the semi-bumbling sidekick. There is nothing that this film delivers that you didn't see last summer...or the summer before that. If you really must see it, wait for pay-per-view and watch it only if there's nothing but info-mercials on every channel on the grid. The best moments of this movie were the ones I spent in the restroom.

Overall, I think the movie was really good. I won't say that it's the "best" I've ever seen, but it was good. The plot didn't suck, even though it was sorta expectable. Sure, everyone knew that Dracula was going to die, but the way they did it was very unique. No one expected, even I didn't, that Van Helsing was going to be turned into a werewolf. And I don't think that anyone expected Anna to die. Even though it sorta sucked that she died, it was a good ending. The fact that she died made the movie more realistic, because not everything has a happy ending. The graphics were awesome, especially with the werewolves. Plus, Hugh Jackman was hot. I rate it a solid 8 out of 10! Oh, and I hope they come out with a sequel. ^.^ It'd be really awesome!

I think if you like all out action and not a real deep storyline Van Helsing delivers with flying colors! It deserves better than a5.2 rating, guess not enough people have gone to watch it yet. It probably has 2004's best mind-blowing special-effects and whether he's hacking some system (Swordfish) or slicing and dicing(X2), Hugh Jackman is the epitome of cool in a movie.Yeah the movie is one explosion after the other but at least it is not just senseless violence, I've heard good comments from both 54 year old women and 13 year old kids. That's both ends of the spectrum which says something .In conclusion Van Helsing deserves a little more credit than it's been getting after how many other movies have the hero fighting a giant dog!

Went to see this film last weekend after being disappointed that we couldn't get tickets to go see 'The Day After Tomorrow' because it had sold out! So instead of going home, we decided to see 'Van Helsing'. Hmmmm.......what can I say? Interesting concept, very good effects and make up and of course costume but on the whole, it was a cross between 1950s 'b' movies and comic strip stories. The director had thrown out the rule book on the origins of Dracula, Frankenstein, etc and has put them all into one film. Was entertaining but won't be buying it on DVD when it is inevitably released in the UK. The best thing I can say about it is the vampires where kick-ass!!

And, if you like alittle love story in things, it has it too!!!***** Movie. you could have been more storyline to it and more character details .when you start it was n't know where the movie was being and van was hunting down nedd more depth to it!need to hunt more monster down in it before the end was to be more detail to it, talk vampires we need know they were doing and hoe they got to there hideout without mess up the ending too muchover all it was great movie but for the money we paid to see it ~!

Yeah, Van Helsing is a nice film. But too many "poetic licences". There are a lot of ropes, there just to help one character to jump and then finish right at the exact time and place where he/her is supposed to be ? OK, I might live with that, only if it was all. Another thing, in the middle of the Carpathians, in a lost village full of ugly farmers ready to suspect anyone lives Anna Valerious, this woman that appears with such a beauty has sprung from those people? I hardly believe that. But after all, Jackman was perfect and Roxburgh too, the costumes where wonderful and even the settings. Nice way to spend an evening, if you don't have anything better to watch.

We are, of course, supposed to be rooting for Van Helsing when watching this film, but what with the regular cheesy and clichéd dialogue of the heroes and the incredibly effective vampire charm of Richard Roxburgh's, I switched sides pretty much as soon as I saw him.Roxburgh is undoubtedly the best Dracula ever! He really has that charm over women that Dracula was reputed to have and he looked great. Although Hugh Jackman did have some cool little scenes, they all look pretty rubbish next to Draculas...Definitely a must see for all Roxburgh fans.Either way, it's still an entertaining film and if you're not expecting too much script and story wise, you'll have a blast watching it!Can't wait for the DVD!

Review title: I've got a bad feeling about this...
Review_body: (WARNING: SPOILERS AHEAD)OK, before I even start this, lets just say my expectations were extremely low. The previews for Van Helsing gave me flash-backs to League of Exdrodinary Gentlemen, which isn't a good thing. The flick started off alright, with a nice fight between Helsing and Dr. Jeckyl (Mr. Hyde?). However, thats where the fun pretty much ends. As a movie goes on, one expects the characters to be developed and given, well, character. All we know about Helsing is that he was found by the Vatican, and he hunts monsters for some secret government agency. When the protagonist has a mysterious past, its expected that in the movie, he's going to find out his past history. This, of course, never happens. At any time does the movie even try to tell the audience where this man came from.Anyway, our protagonist goes on a journey to, wait for it, Transylvania where he, wait for it again, battles Dracula! Now this isn't your normal, everyday Dracula, who is slick, sly and seductive. This is a bad thing. Just when I thought the writer (Steven Summers) couldn't make a character less dimensional then Helsing, he tosses in Dracula. For some reason Dracula needs both Frankenstein's monster and a werewolf to raise his army of vampire offspring. Dracula, who is thousands of years old, calls Helsing by the name Gabriel. Apparently, he and Helsing have been battling for centuries, but neither Helsing nor the audience is ever fully clued in to this fact. Dracula only gets lamer when his weakness is revealed. For a reason unknown, Dracula is immune to the usual vampire slaying repitoir of sun light, garlic, and stakes to the heart. His only weakness is, werewolves. Wait, dosn't Dracula employ werewolves? Yes, he employs them for his personal protection, which is totally ludacris. Would Superman wear kryptonite underwear because of the added support? I think not. Oh yeah, Dracula is also a married man, three times over, who knew.If I had a dollar for evertime I saw a twenty minute long "fight scene" between the brides of Dracula, or a werewolf, or any monster and Helsing, I could have paid for the movie, thrice. This presents another problem. Van Helsing is an action movie by nature, and one would assume that the movie sensibly sacrifices plot for explosions, death, and snappy one-liners, however it fails miserably at presenting any good action qualities. It regurgitates the same fights, by moving the location and number of people in the fight. The first fight will be on par with other recent action movies, the others will bore you to tears. The character development problem plagues this movie to every extent. Frankenstein's Monster, a John Goodman-esque meat-head, is either a super intelligent genius or a complete blithering idiot. Somewhere Mary Shelly is spinning in her grave at 100mph. Helsing discovers this poor sack in a cave, which Helsing conveniently fell into, and immediately falls in love with it. Even after Frankenstein insist that Helsing kill him because he is the key to Dracula's evil plan, Helsing insist that he won't, and that he must protect Fathead, and thus drag the dying horse of a movie on for another hour. Lastly, the movie takes itself way too seriously, for a flick that should've been a mindless monster bashing. Steven Summers, seems to think that when people go to action movies such as Van Helsing they are expecting to see a moving story with intense. This, of course, isn't true. Action movies should contain minimal plot, but still contain enough smooth and witty dialogue so the audience doesn't fall asleep from repeditive fight scenes made up of characters who the audience could care less died. When making an action movie, a writer/director must follow three simple rules: 1) The enemy must be something hated by all: I suggest Natzi's, Commies, Terrorists, Robots from the future, Aliens, all of which will be hated by all red-blooded Americans, forever. 2) Special Effects alone don't make an action movie: Hooray! Explosions and Monsters that look soooooo real. Special effects work only when applied sensibly, or with good use (see Jurassic Park or Lord of the Rings). They are not made to replace dialouge or character development. 3) The audience MUST be able to connect with the protagonist: Whether its a vampire hunter or a NY police officer, the audience must be able to see life in the leading role. A lame character has no pull on the audience when the movie puts said character into danger.Van Helsing failed on mostly every level. I'll give it points for nice visuals, but after two and a half hours, they get old. This is one of the first movies I've been too where I've seen people leave then movie before its been finished and show looks of disgust after the movie finished (and I saw 8 legged freaks). If your not wanting to pay 7+ bucks to see the poster for Spiderman 2 and the trailer for The Village, go to the library and read Bram Stroker's Dracula and Merry Shelly's Frankenstein, or if your not into the reading thing just rent some old monster movies. Trust me on this one.Rating: * (1 out of 5 stars)

Review title: Not as bad as everyone said.
Review_body: I know Van Helsing got a lot of bad reviews, but I really enjoyed it. It was two and a half hours long, but didn't feel like it. They managed to combine many different horror stories, and yet make them all work. It was sort of like an Abbot and Costello flick, but it still pulled it off. The graphics were very nice as well, but the thing I enjoyed the most was that the werewolves actually looked like wolves! They weren't giant gorillas like they are in most horror movies, they were giant wolves.I wouldn't say this was an amazing movie, but it was definitely a fun movie, and well worth the 8 bucks to get in.

Wow, I thought this was a wonderful film. Dracula (Richard Roxburgh) is superbly menacing, Frankenstein's monster is very well played - the make-up and acting are superb and Hugh Jackman is spot on as the monster killer. A nice mix of humour, plot and action. The sets are breathtaking, the attention to detail is superb, the film has a very Gothic feel about it and the action is more or less non-stop. The werewolves are very realistic, the change from man to wolf is harrowing and fascinating to watch, similarly the change of the vampires to their flying 'bat' forms are smooth and believable. Dracula's brides in particular are brilliantly scary. There are some gaffes, e.g characters showing knowledge of things that happened when they weren't in the scene but they detracts nothing from the film. I enjoyed this film so much, I went to the cinema twice to see it. Here's hoping there is a sequel.

Brilliant, Every part of this movie is thrilling. It is a rare occasion when a movie grabs you and keeps you enthralled throughout the entire movie. Sommers blows you away with the special effects. The creature look as they are supposed to look. The talent that was put into this movie was incredible. The beautiful Kate Beckinsale(underworld, Pearl Harbor) was great. Hugh Jackman does a perfect job portraying this mysterious evil hunter. This is a movie that defines what a summer movies should be. That is should be great and enticing. This movie will put a standard for summer movies. There are not enough movies like this. It is a diamond in the rough and it is a movie to be remembered.

Review title: Where has all the logic gone ?
Review_body: Well, there has not been a movie like this for some time. Ads for it everywhere, no matter if subway, television or print media. I admit Mr. Wolverine did his job very well, but even a good actor cant save the movie if the script is that bad. It looks as if they took the plot of 200 B-movies, put it together - no matter if there are huge logical holes in this storyline. Okay, the sexy Underground-Lady is fighting against Werewolves, Vampires, even against Mr. Longteeth himself (should this be the prototype of a gay vampire king?) and doesn't even get scratched. But in the end, she gets killed (!) or rather crushed by Helsing. Helloooo??? Please, do me one favour and don't do a 2nd part of this nightmare.

"It had great special effects." That's about all i heard from any source before going to see this movie. Unfortunately, to a movie, that little five-letter phrase is like what "Can't we just be friends?" is to a relationship: A hint that nothing good is about to happen.So i went to see it anyway? Of course i did. This movie HAD to be good. I'd been waiting for it to come out for nearly a year. Everything about the concept interested me. A sort of Vampire$ meets Blade. I was even thinking about how pitifully the upcoming Blade 3 would pale in comparison to Van Helsing. I haven't been that naive since the 3rd time i said "I do."You probably want me to elaborate on what was so bad about it. I wish i could nail it down to any one thing. But i can't quite put my finger on it.I'll start with the convoluted plot. James Bond, er, i mean Van Helsing, an agent of MI-6, er, i mean a secret religious security/intelligence agency under the auspices of the churches of multiple religious faiths, is sent (accompanied by Q, er, i mean Carl, the weapons/gadgets expert from MI-6, er, I mean...oh forget it!) to find/aid the last remaining descendants of a family that has been battling Count Dracula for several centuries. Why the sudden urgency? Because the family pledged long ago never to set foot in heaven until the Count has been defeated. Should the last of the family fall, their souls and those of all their ancestors will be forever in limbo between heaven and purgatory. There's an equally convoluted sub-plot/co-plot involving the Dracula family that i won't bother going into as there's no easy way to do it without going spoilers.The actors/actresses all seemed about as interested in being in this movie as i felt in watching it. Jackman, Beckinsale and Roxburgh, all of whom I've loved in multiple other roles, gave performances worthy of only the most mediocre of after-school-specials. Granted, the movie was so fast-paced that there wasn't much room for petty little things like feeling, or character development, i still couldn't help but imagine as i sat there, how much better the movie might have been if it had been performed as a school play by one of my 2nd wife's kindergarten classesI hope the writers/producers of this masterpiece are already in a back room somewhere shredding documents and deleting e-mails, because just like in the Enron incident, they've got some 'splaining to do. They're going to have to explain to someone eventually why this movie was made in the first place, much less released in theaters.

Review title: A fun movie...who cares what the critics think!
Review_body: This movie is a fun movie to watch, and being that I am a graphic artist and very familiar with CGI, I would say it is also an amazing film with aspects that have not been used in any other action films.The point of a movie is not to pick it apart and be hyper critical, it's to have fun with it, enjoy it, and respect it. Not all movies suit all tastes, but for those who enjoy the Gothic genre, this movie is quite pleasing, and to some I have talked to, very exciting! I personally felt it was brilliant in many ways, and yes, I do feel it may have been a little too fast paced at times, it was still a great story and a very enjoyable film.Critical nitpicking be damned! If it makes you jump at the scary parts, laugh at the funny parts, and cry at the sad parts, then it's everything it was supposed to be and worth dropping the cash to see or purchase when it eventually comes out on DVD!

After leaving the cinema, i couldn't help but to have un answered questions in my head about this film. OK the story line wasn't great, or was it because i was trying to compare it to "the league of extraordinary gentlemen" which is why i didn't enjoy it as much as i would of liked to. to be fair to hugh jackman i thought he played his part very well, as he has done in x-men 1 & 2 and i thought he was brilliant in swordfish. I must comment on the special effects as with most films now a days they were second to none i really like the scene in notre damm where our hero dr. van helsing is in chase of mr hyde where they finally come face to face with each other before a fight breaks out, the effects of that are fantastic but overall its the story that counts and I'm afraid to say in my view, the story line did let it down, it could have been a much better film.

Review title: Don't be deterred by bad reviews
Review_body: This is the best film I've seen lately- not because of any dramatic impact that it carries, but simply because it is a fun, well-designed, monster flick. Understand that you can't go into a movie featuring Frankenstein's Monster and expect Shakespeare. The plot is admittedly thin, and the Universal Monsters have been around for so long that they've become somewhat unimpressive, but the director has done a very good job of minimizing these factors to create a visually and emotionally appealing film. The sets and characters are beautifully designed; there are no real instances of bad acting; the action is fast-paced and not too predictable; and the whole thing combines to create one really great adventure film, if you only give it a chance. I'm glad that I did. A must-see for vampire-lovers, and for those who liked The Mummy and Pirates of the Caribbean.

One of the worst movies I've ever seen in the theater.I couldn't wait till the movie ended. During the movie the film and sound messed up, however this was one of the good points. When the movie returned to normal, a great sadness fell upon me. However, there was one point in the movie that was exciting. In fact I can't remember when i've been this excited over the ending of a movie...LOLSeriously, though, the characters were boring. The actor who played Dracula, was one of the worst actors i've seen in a long time. But it wasn't' all his fault, part of it was the script. I can't believe I wasted over 2 hours of my life there. I can never get that back. :(

Review title: Great show. Not a Movie Experience.
Review_body: I fell in love with the premise of this movie. For all you fantasy fans out there, it was taking an old cleric/scholar and turning him into a kick-butt paladin/assassin. The more I read the promos, the more I loved the idea.Then I saw the movie.I still appreciated the premise. The scripting was pretty good, minus two or three scenes. Great action movie. The overall movie experience was lacking.Its special effects were its great strength and weakness. They spent so much money and time on getting the effects right, they seemed to skimp on the little things: choreography, accent coaches, wardrobe, music, lighting, set design. These are the things that make the movie an experience rather than just a show.VAN HELSING & ANNA (Lead characters) The two main characters were very well done. I can't really complain much about them. They were well written, well acted, well directed, well wardrobed. . . I do wish they had given some character development as to why Anna was able to fight so well. But it was a long enough movie as it was, maybe they cut it out for time.Dracula Richard Roxburgh did an excellent job in his execution of his script. But he could have made his speech about having no heart a little more than one-dimensional. Let's face it, in a movie like this, we appreciate a villain that has SOME redeeming quality. His interchange with Van Helsing was much more impressive. And he handled his death rather well. Excellent method of showing a vampire's healing abilities.THE VAMPIRESSES (Dracula's brides) The vampiresses should have just been extras. Their action sequences were great. But every time they opened their mouths, I rolled my eyes and was just waiting for the next scene. They didn't really add anything to the plot or the movie except for their fights. I didn't even think they were sexy. Especially not in those campy outfits they had on. They looked like they were trying out for some psychic hotline ad.CARL ("I'm not a monk. I'm just a friar") This was a work of genius as far as character creation goes. They give you a great taste of what it would be like if James Bond had Q with him on his assignments as a sidekick. Although I feel it was a simple part for an actor, I have to give David Wendham credit for performing it well.IGOR His line,"It's what I do" pretty much sums it up. You can't have a movie like this without Igor. And he was doing exactly what we expected him to do. But someone was going to ask "why is he doing that?" So, they had Dracula ask for us. It's just what he does. Don't question it.SET DESIGN Most of the scenes were very good. But I'd think the most important set would be inside Dracula's castle. And that is where the set designer really disappointed me. Maybe it was partially the lighting and camera work. Maybe other little factors. But the cobwebs were overdone and the entire set looked too plastic. The colors were just slightly off to make it look like it was faked. Again, if I'm there to just see an action movie, OK. But the promos made it seem like it was going to be a little deeper than that.WARDROBE Van Helsing was well outfitted. As was Dracula. I could even say that the friar was done OK, but how can you go wrong with a plain brown robe? Everyone else looked really campy. Anna's wardrobe: designed well, poorly excecuted. It needed slightly different fabrics or colors that would project differently on the big screen.SPECIAL EFFECTS The battle scenes with the vampiresses and even the baby vampires were good.I never felt like I was suspending any disbelief. I just looked and felt I'd been transported. The transformation sequences were good for both Dracula and the werewolves. But when they had their final battle, they fell victim to the same problem that all heavily CG characters have. The speed and balance of the characters is always slightly off from reality. The only way I could console myself was that these were superhuman creatures able to violate some laws of physics in a fantasy movie. Even then, it was an effort to suspend my disbelief. Van Helsing's weapons were very well designed. Obviously not realistic for the era. But it was not too big a stretch for this genre of movie.EXPERIENCE This is a quality of movies that I don't see much comment on. It takes into account things like flow of the movie, emotions not only portrayed by the actors, but absorbed by the audience, the feeling that you are actually in the scene.For this quality, I'll have to give an 8 for a few scenes, but a 2 or 3 for the rest of the movie.SUMMARY If you're looking for an action movie that has someone being the superhero and kicking butt (Swarzennegger's --Commando) it's a great movie. They made some effort at being an intelligent movie as well, but only had limited success at executing that goal.If you want a movie that made you feel like you want to hear more about these characters and this world you've just been introduced to (Lord of the Rings), this was OK, but not a great movie.Cloud Castle

Review title: ". . . full of sound and fury, signifying nothing."
Review_body: This is an atrocious movie. It constitutes one of only three films I've ever actually wanted to walk out of despite having paid theater rates (I've only ever walked out of one). _Van_Helsing_ possesses no plot or character development other than tired and overly used clichés. The only redeeming and creative effort I can discern occurs in the presentation of the end credits. Vast amounts of stimuli shouldn't be boring, but it's clearly possible.This movie makes _Underworld_ (also starring Beckinsale) look like a work of genius, and _X2_ (also starring Jackman) seem like a well thought out effort.

Review title: Great action adventure sequences, Gothic good vs. evil
Review_body: Though definitely not a horror movie fan, I liked Van Helsing because it had enough action and also had good characters and a basic theme of good vs. evil. Hugh Jackman was wonderful, believable and ruggedly handsome as the famous monster hunter and David Wenham was hilarious as a naughty but brilliant inventor-friar. The special effects were amazing. I enjoyed the Gothic settings as well, with the huge sets, cliffs, great halls, old castles, and grand cathedrals. It was a fun and exhilarating action-horror movie. The movie had great action adventure sequences and Gothic good vs. evil and maybe the critics ought to lighten up and realize that producers of action adventure and horror movies aren't all trying to bombard us with 100% emotionally wrenching movies like "Terms of Endearment".

This isn't a review as much as it is a part of a self-therapeutic process to get over a stinking experience.Before I begin, I'd like to tell you about something that characterises this inflated project where far too much money have been involved. I noticed some advertisement for a writing competition connected to this film. It stated that you should submit a story containing certain words and among them was (I kid you not) "Van Helsing the computer game". After reading that, it was only by chance I came to see this film, as I walked by a free showing out in the open, no charge. There is a certain type of film where you get the feeling that they cut down on working on the manuscript in order to beef up the special effects department. It usually has 'big' names fronting it, like Chuck Norris or Van Damme. Plot weaknesses are abundant and there is a clear tendency where every car crash ends with an explosion. For a film on the supernatural set before the invention of the automobile, this sure do come close to that description. Lousy acting, a story so illogical it hurts even if you've switched your brain to "sit back and enjoy the ride" and a 'car chase' that ends with an explosion.Some dosage of this might be forgivable if it is a shoe-string budget film made by a rookie and three of his or hers friends. This, in lack of better words, 'entity' contains digital artwork by WETA (Lord of the Rings), fabulous locations(among others a cathedral), made by an experienced director alongside actors that have been seen in cinemas before and costumes that Anne Rice would dream of putting on her characters. The sad thing is, it all feels wasted. A film that so much relies on special effects, doesn't even put them to good use.Now I didn't expect high-quality acting or a great artwork made a by a great director. After all, Stephen Sommers did The Mummy Returns. I do expect to at some degree to find enjoyment. Seeing horrible versions of classic characters being torn to pieces (did they say "Here's an idea: Let's combine Frankenstein's monster with Tarzan!" in the planning stage?) on expensive sets in hopeless settings doesn't include in this. I had no expectations of excellence, but any hopes of mere mediocrity was blown away. Highlander and Universal Soldier are great series going strong in comparison. Considering that the original Dracula manages to be creepy by the mere use of shadows and make-up at a time when the director's title was 'herr doktor', then Van Helsing is an artistic failure.I should say that I didn't watch the entire film. It being an outdoor showing on a plaza, I took time to go and buy myself a hot dog and some soda. I also arrived after it had begun, somewhere before Jack Hughman meets Kate Beckinsale. Even for a free show, this felt disturbingly incompetent. This is from the guy who quite liked Underworld in some of it's moments; save yourself the trouble and do NOT watch this film. Valid alternatives include renting Highlander, taking a look at episodes of Narnia or go down to your video store, close your eyes and point at random. Both Willow and Ronja Røverdatter knocks Van Helsing down into his socks and those were made before CGI with main characters under 5 foots.

Review title: Great movie...saw it about 10 times in the theater alone. (This is a spoiler..if you have not seen this movie, do not read!!!)
Review_body: This is my favorite movie during the time I have been out of school. IT was a completely awesome movie. I saw it 10 times in the theater and loved it even more each time. Richard Roxburgh is excellent in portraying my absolute all time favorite villain. And of course Hugh Jackman shows his stuff very well once again as Van Helsing himself. I loved everything about the movie except Dracula dying of course, and perhaps Anna dying too...not a perfect ending but I loved the rest. I would definitely recommend this movie to anyone within the the rating limit. The action and adventure will take you back to the theaters again and again if you love movies like that. It is just awesome. That is the best word to describe it.

Review title: video game or movie you decide
Review_body: Van helsing, noise, mediocre CGI, more noise, bad CGI, and yes more noise. Oh my! yes predictable lame summer blockbuster dialog didn't escape this 2004 blockbuster. Let me not be so harsh, there is some positive, Val helsing is a great looking DVD, perhaps one of the top five looking DVDs you will ever see. Got one of those LCD, HDTV TVs well this is a show piece of how good a modern movie can look on your new screen. As a movie Van helsing assumes you have seen movies about Dracula, Frankinstein, and Ware wolves, you won't learn anything new or to better put it there is nothing new. Van Helsing looks and feel like a video game, actors are set against the back drop of some beautiful computer graphics. One more positive production design is top notch. The lead characters Val helsing played by Huge Jackman and his co-op partner/player/actress Kate Beckinsale (see her in underworld recommended), they shoot, fight CGI monsters for over two hours, surrounded by a fairly decent musical score...more noise and CGI video game looking villains characters pop out of nowhere to keep our hero busy.Jackman and Beckinsale play along, reciting dialog every so often while dogging/shooting flying things like in a video game, they solve puzzles like in a video game. Val helsing come down to " opportunity cost " Do you want to watch your favorite video game for two hours or play Resident evil 4, Castlevania or even Van helsing: the video game for two hours.There are much better movies, books and games about Frankinstein and Dracula you can entertain yourself with, than viewing Van Helsing. But if you are into CGI, video games and state of the art home entertainment systems. Van Helsing will compliment your time but not your mind. 3/10 as a movie, 7/10 as a video game you are forced to watch for two hours and 9/10 as a DVD show piece. again opportunity cost.

Review title: Van Helsing a song of sixpence..
Review_body: I'm not sure why this film was made. In retrospect, I'm not sure why any movie gets made, but I'm particularly confused about this one. The cast was adequate, but this movie seems confused about whether it's a comedy, an action movie, or a horror movie. And this is the biggest problem with Van Helsing. If it could've chosen a genre to fall into, it might have worked. But it insists on being everything, and as a result, falls far short in it's attempt. The effects in Van Helsing(particularly the creature ones) are relatively well blended, but... well... not terribly impressive. With one exception(and I won't spoil which one... it's pretty obvious). The dialogue, while trying to be impressive and dramatic, is occasionally painful and forced. As a fan of many of the myths presented in Van Helsing, I found their treatment to be inadequate and disappointing.Overall, I wasn't terribly disappointed. I'd already heard that the movie wasn't all that impressive, so I didn't have any expectations. If you're not a fan of the mythic or Gothic genres however, and you like lots of bright flashes on your TV, check this movie out. You'll probably like it. I sure didn't.

This movie was actually so bad that I felt compelled to get an IMDb account just so that I could write a review for that pathetic piece of sh*t. This movie is an insult to any vampire movie that's ever been done (yes including the cheesy ones). Let's go step by step : The story : Totally incoherent. Vampires + Werewolves + Frankenstein + Dr Jekyll + James bond like stuff = One of the worst scenarios ever. Acting : Average at best. The characters : They're all so archetypal that I almost feel sorry for the guys who made that movie. The amnesiac anti hero, the adventurous hot chick, the evil vampire, the good doctor blinded by his ambition, ... They're all here. Dialogues : One cheesy line after another. I even wonder why I gave it a 2 instead of a 1. Do yourself a favor and stay way from that thing. You can't even call that a movie.

I admit the movie is often stupid. But what do you expect of this kind of movie? The movie is a fast and loud eye candy. I really enjoyed the huge amount of FX and unrealistic but fun action scenes. That's what I expected. It's a fantasy comic movie and for that I like it. If you expect a serious horror movie, don't watch this. This movie isn't really scary. Sadly, the actors are nothing special in this movie. Richard Roxburgh as Dracula just isn't scary, too bad. Kate Beckinsale as Anna Valerious is boring too. The best characters are Dracula's Brides. I like the way the fly and get transformed. The sets and digital matte paintings are beautiful!If you like FX, fantasy and sweeping camera moves, this is a must see! Verdict: Good entertainment, nothing more!

This excuse for a film is painful to watch. The characters are boring and uninspired, and the plot/script seems little more than an afterthought. Hollywood was wondering why theaters were seeing a drop in attendance? People are tired of being burned at the box office with tripe like this.The REAL plot of the movie is as follows: Executive #1: We need more money.Executive #2: How about we take a hot actor and throw him in a movie with CGI monsters? Executive #1: Great idea! But effects cost money...Executive #2: Nah, we'll save money by getting my gardener to write the script. He practically works for nothing as it is.Executive #1: One condition. The portrayal of Dracula has to be insulting to everything Dracula/vampire related before it.Executive #2: Deal. Okay then, it's settled. We'll make millions off of the poor suckers once again! And the worst part? The CGI wasn't even that good. Please, do not spend ANY amount of money on this movie. If you do, they will keep making stuff like this instead of pushing ahead with good movies.

Non-stop action, a wide variety of characters (comic-relief, adventurer, hot female warrior, evil villain.) Sure, the story lines a little hard to follow and stuff, but who goes to a movie rated PG-13 for "Non-stop creature action" for a storyline? I kinda read the storyline before hand, and it was easier to follow. The characters Transylvannian accents sometimes made them hard to understand. The way Mr. Hyde, Dracula, The Wolf man, and Frankenstien all meld together into one movie is spectacular! All in all, it's a good movie, and I'll be getting ti on DVD October 8TH! YAY! I al least advise all you who haven't seen it to rent it and turn on the subtitles so you can pick up the accents and understand them!

This movie can be viewed in many ways. Possibly as a non-stop action movie, or as a frighteningly fast paced film, or even as a waste of money. I chose the latter. This movie had the talent, the legendary characters, but nothing else. The script was a disaster. I spent half the movie staring at my watch as it interested me more than the movie. The acting was done by professionals, but the plot lacked sanity so their talent was hard to recognize. I can't say more as I am already forgetting the characters names who starred in this disaster. If/before you rent this movie, remember, this movie will leave you frozen to your seats, Asleep.

Oh dear, oh dear, never mess with legends. Utter nonsense. Rubbish I mean, for god's sake, if you're going to cast KATE BECKINSALE don't expect anything but rubbish. The only redeeming features of this film are Hugh Jackman, always charming, and the rather fit sisters/brides of Dracula, which ever title they gave them in this dire production. Starts off quite interesting, and then oh of course, Van Helsing fights Dr. Jekyll and his alter ego, in NOTRE DAME!! Absurd! Why not have him fight the hunchback- at least that would make sense. Oh and then of course, there is always the fact that Frankenstein has the power or whatever to bring Dracula's children to life- this is all becoming too much of a joke. There is also the genius of capturing sunlight in a ball, my god how many times have we seen that; it's so far from being an original trick that the last time I remember seeing it was in Buffy (TV). All in all, this is laughable, possibly the worst thing, i say thing as it is not just the worst film I've ever seen, it's the worst thing that ever existed. Laughable.

No need to say it's a kids movie. It's been said. No need to say there's plenty of SGI. It's been said. What they don't like saying is that it's actually a very good movie and serves its purpose. And its cast is very cleverly chosen. Hugh Jackman, Kate Beckinsale and Richard Roxburgh are excellent leads andtheir film mates are just as good. My mention goes to the brides, who deliver the most interesting performances . Not much to say about Marishka(Maran), who is killed at the beginning of themovie.Gorgeous, i'd say! Aleera (Anaya) gives a psycho like performance. You could make a whole movie out of those eyes! Verona (Colloca), the queen bride, could come from a Bela Lugosi movie, sheis right there, she is the dark, Gothic, sad vampire you feel sorry for when she's killed.very interesting choices from Steve sommers who proves to be a very smart film director.

Before I start I am going to state right now that I am biased towards the werewolf in this film. I love werewolves.I watched this movie in theater and I will buy the DVD because of one character. The werewolves. In my honest opinion, I believe that this movie has the best looking werewolves I have ever seen. They are very close to how I envision them. It just goes to show that CGI is the way to go. I just wish for one thing to make the werewolf 100% complete. NEXT TIME PLEASE GIVE THE WEREWOLF A FRIGGIN TAIL! It makes no sense why the werewolf does not have a tail. Besides, aren't tails supposed to help maintain balance when they decide to run on all fours? Besides, the werewolves "DID" have digitigrades legs for a reason you know!Oh BTW. For all of you CGI haters. I am sorry, but I am going to have to go pro CGI with this movie, for it is top-notch work. Can you imagine keeping the movie at the pace it was set at without the use of CGI?..... No. I didn't think so. I also heard that some of you hated the transformation sequences between the vampire and the werewolf. Well just what in the hell were you looking for exactly? Something where each character takes five minutes to slowly transform from human into beast? Sorry, that doesn't work well in a fast paced action movie like this, because it doesn't keep up with the fast pace of the movie. Besides; let's say if I was in the movie and they were going through their transformation sequences, I could have waltzed in with a sword, chopped both of their heads off and walked out before they could even finish. So that is why their Transformation sequences were quick.Please feel free to reply to this and challenge me if you want. I enjoy ranting about stuff like this. =)

What a Great Movie! I personally thought that this movie was going to suck royally, but I had nothing better to watch, so I rented it anyways. It's actually a very good movie! I was impressed with the effects, and I thought they chose some pretty good actors to play the parts. The details of the vampires and the change from human to werewolf, were the best I've seen in a movie in a long time! It is also a movie that makes you think. I wont ruin it by going into it, you'll have to watch and find out if there is anything that makes you think "wow, I didn't know that". Don't miss the movie, or you'll end up regretting it.

One of the best action movies of the year, biggest weakness was the plot, however it stays consistent with Universal's monster legends and keeps the continuum steady.Jackman is truly a star and he Kate carried this movie. The props and sets were very well done, and the filmography is great. It's a shame the plot was so horrendous, or otherwise this movie's action and effects could have carried it alone.Werewolf transformations, the rules of vampires were kept in line very well, Frankenstein's monster was portrayed very well, but could have spoke less. :p

i found myself asking again and again while watching this 132 minute long romance novel cover, "why are there homeless people when someone is capable of giving money to this?" save yourself the trouble of watching this... just imagine the most played out themes, overacting heroes and villains, and put them in a one-liner filled, horribly written shiny package, and you've pretty much gotten the gist of van helsing. it seems as though Mr. sommers failed to pay attention to anything the likes of Kurosawa, lean, or even Spielberg could have taught about making epic hero movies. if i were eight years old again, i might have liked it, but i could never, ever respect it- hands down, one of, if not the worst thing i've ever seen.

Review title: A fun movie, but not a timeless classic.
Review_body: A fun movie, good special effects and fair to good acting, but no big surprises in the plot. A good way to spend a rainy afternoon if your not looking for a "gone with the wind" classic. Hugh Jackman as Van Helsing worked well, he seemed to enjoy the part and made the character fun to watch, His sidekick, Friar Carl, played by David Wenham, in a role touching on "Q" from the James Bond series of movies, fell a little short in the comic relief department but worked in the role none the less. The lead female role "love interest" Ann Valerious, played by Kate Beckinsale, a good actress, she managed to pull it off with a role that was somewhat less then believable. Count Dracula, played by Richard Roxburgh, was somewhat wooden in his performance, but considering the part he had to work with he did well. I liked Frankinstein's monster, played by Shuler Hensley, the role was played in the style of Boris Karloff's classic Frankenstein, and the makeup and special effects were excellent in all roles! Written and directed by Stephen Sommers, This is a good action-adventure film even if the plot is somewhat worn from use.

I study a lot of film, and I know that there are two types of movies.1) Movies made to please the gods, uh, I mean the critics. 2) Movies made for the average viewer.This was not a number one styled film, it was a two. And despite some historical inaccuracies (but really, if you were picking it apart already, you weren't really into the movie) it was a good movie.It introduced some new ideas, like Dracula and the three wives trying to reproduce, involving the werewolves, etc. I had a lot of fun with it. It was action packed, the CGI's were decent. All in all, a great movie!(but that's just me)

Review title: Entertainning, good plot and great special effects
Review_body: People usually thinks that this movie is not so good but I think is underrated. The movie has a good plot overall, it contains really good special effects, has a good cast and it has an innovative way to capture this important fictional character "Van Helsing". I thought that from beginning to end was completely entertaining. Has a lot of action but also good romance and a little bit of history in it. You just won't get tired of watching this film. The film is really good just to spend the afternoon with a story that has action, suspense, drama and romance. This movie is just pure fun. Van Helsing is a James Bond character of dark Transylvania. And his battles against Dracula are a roller coaster ride with non-stop action and vivid, beautiful scenery. If you are an art film snob don't watch this movie but truth is that in general terms is just a well done entertaining film.

Review title: It's a shame that so few realize how terrible this film is
Review_body: Drawing on every cliché known to man, Van Helsing serves as a testament to a plot based less on intelligence than it is on testosterone. This has some of the most facets going against it of any movie I've seen. First of all, it's doomed right away when attempting not one- but several classic horror stories- all pieced together like a quilt made by a mentally challenged armless...well, Hollywood director. It attempts to use the melodramatic air as classic and endearing but instead ends up with Frankentstein's monster yelling the most stereotypical "Why?!?!" while holding a dead body, and such witty lines as "Do you like to fly?" (or something close) when Van Helsing is lifted in the air by she-vampires. Terrible, terribly done film- but the most disappointing part is that it wasn't acknowledged as being as terrible as it was.

I noticed that there was some crap on the lenceof camera in scenes 6-8. It was located in the right side maybe one third from the bottom of the picture. I would like to remove it digitally if I had the master. Or someone could. Did anyone see it in the first place. I cannot watch these scenes because of the crap or scratch or whatever. I tried to find the e-mail address of the director of photography but i did not find it anywhere but i think he is a very busy man in the first place so i wish i was too but in general i liked the film. and thats the reason i gave 7 i would have given more but even this one was 1,7 above the average so it really doesn't matter anyway.

Review title: Don't bother with this one, especially if you like Sommers previous work.
Review_body: This movie was a huge disappointment. I sat down expecting a movie of with a decent story, some cool fight scenes, and interesting characters who would defeat a really big scary bad guy. Decent story, um no. Too many incongruities and unanswered questions. Cool fight scenes...okay I give in here...there were some interesting fights, but nothing truly spectacular. Interesting characters. They could have been, but they were so poorly presented to the audience that I had to wonder whether the director considers his audience to be mentally incapacitated. Character history is spoon-fed in stilted dialogue and you don't truly get a sense of any of the characters. And big scary bad guy...just no.The worst part is that this could have been a truly entertaining action movie. Unfortunately, half an hour into it I couldn't figure out whether the lead had serious angst or not, and was in fact wondering whether this was an action, drama, comedy, or horror flick. The techniques Sommers used to highlight humor, drama and action in earlier films were so inappropriately used as to be distracting from the story...hmm, considering the deficiencies there, perhaps it was intentional.

I thought Richard Gere's "Dr.T and the Women" was bad, but Van Helsing was unbearable. I am a big fan of Hugh Jackman but he was wrong to star in this movie. I am so glad I only wasted a couple of dollars renting it instead of buying the DVD or having seen it in the theater. One critic (that I read "after" watching) said "This isn't a film, it's a cinematic headache...", I wish I had taken the time to search out reviews before renting. The movie started with Dr Jeckyl, changed into his alter ego Mr. Hyde but inexplicably 3 times as large as a normal human and so obviously digitized it was laughable. The whole movie is supposed to be set in the 1800s yet they've got weapons right out from Bond movies and an underground, high tech lab made to look old in Rome run by the church. It's like they threw in every monster and grim looking Transylvanian they could find into this movie and still failed. As with all poor movies only the trailer scenes were engaging. I am so surprised to find any positive comments on this dreadful movie. Last two words of advice for those thinking to rent or buy: "Don't bother."

Review_body: This movie ( Van Helsing ) i thought was great! I loved how it had all of the old movie monsters connected together somehow. The story line was good too. IT is so cool!! All i can say is go out and buy it or rent it right now!!!!!! I know you will love it! I did!

The drac wanted to kill a werewolf by giving him a antidote that would turn him human instead if resorting to silver?1 and kept his secret weapon in a place where he would need eons to get it? and that stuff "i mixed magma from the vesuv with other stuff. could come in handy" (something like that). and of course he wanted to create vampire offspring for ... for what???
