On e moron must have noticed that, and thought they could make some money out of it, and bashed a film together with some special effects.there are more things to add, but i will try to delete the memory of this movie off my memory.to the people pout there don't waste ur time or even money for it.

If you go into this movie without expecting too much, you won't come out disappointed. I didn't really know what to expect before I watched it, I just knew I wanted to, because in the trailers, I thought Dracula looked super cool. That might just be me, though.This movie is obviously not one that was made specifically for craft. The acting isn't marvelous by any means. It's actually a cheeseball of a movie, but it's a fun time none the less. If you're expecting some epic film - you'll get nice visuals, cool shots... that's pretty much it.I must say, the fake accents nearly drove me up a wall. I could live with Beckinsale's accent more than I could Roxburgh's. Personally, I feel Dracula would have been all the cooler if he /didn't/ have the cliché eastern European accent.All in all, it's a decent movie. Lots of questions left if you really think about it, but if you feel like being brainless for a couple hours, it'd be a good movie to spend your time with.

And worth watching if for nothing else but the tongue in cheek repartee between the characters. The costumes were outlandish and the weapons unbelievable but this is to be expected in an updated comic book-like storytelling of the legend of Dracula. Only someone with a seriously fractured funny bone could possibly fail to grasp that the action of exaggerated falls, flips and aerial acrobatics was anything but comedy! Come on guys, get a grip! This is a movie designed to be campy and entertaining, like the Batman or Starwars movies of past decades.Simply put, I liked it! And I also found it amusing to see so many character actors from other recently popular movies having a good time in this one. Look for the recognizable and not so recognizable actors from: Lord of the Rings, The Mummy, The X-Men and The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen. And watch for the lighthearted takeoff on the James Bond and Major Boothrow relationship. Try to guess who was who in what movie while you watch, and compare the actors performance in this movie to their other offerings. And note how Richard Roxburgh almost completely steals the show as the mesmerizing Old Count. To summarize, the movie is a delight for the young at heart, the fans of make believe and devourers of comic books. Folks, see it for yourself and judge! Have some fun! Get a bowl of hot buttered popcorn and a big cold drink and lean back for a rollicking good time and a goodly number of belly laughs at the antics of our heroes, Van Helsing, Anna and Carl vs. the villains, Count Dracula, Igor and The Brides.

Van Helsing is not your typical movie. From being a fast paced action/horror movie, the plot is rather interesting. It keeps the audience's attention with all the action and all the circumstances faced.The actors fit so well into their roles. With the great acting the story had a great flow. The film sure went far into putting in great detail. To the actors, creatures, and the story line, Van Helsing was planned to be a great fantasy movie. This movie is highly recommended to people who love fantasy, action/ horror movies. The shots also add to the greatness of the movie. The locations are absolutely breath taking and the camera shooting techniques add great perspectives. Van Helsing is a monster movie that can't be passed up.

Review title: One hell of a good time!
Review_body: The cgi may be a little dated, but try to turn the critical mind off and enjoy the movie for what it really is. Van Helsing is a love letter to classic Universal Studios monster films and it stands well on it's own. The cast led by Hugh Jackman, Kate Beckinsale, and Richard Roxburgh appear to be having a good time making the movie and it shows in the final product. The visuals including cinematography and set pieces are stunning at times and beautiful. This is a movie that is truly enjoyable and I cannot recommend it enough.

Satire,spoof-or a semi-serious horror movie? Director/writer Stephen Sommers combines all three in this enjoyable flick which I dug up in my local library. Indicates it wasn't a howling box office or DVD success! Van Helsing is full of references to other past movies such as The legendary 1939 Hunchback of Notre Dame,starring Charles Laughton as the batty bell-ringer. I won't spoil your fun. See how many references you can spot yourselves. Then there are characters from other horror classic tales who make freaky "guest appearances" like Mr Hyde, played by marvellous British character actor Robbie Coltrane. Coltrane is equally adept at turning his hand to both comedy or serious drama such as the highly-acclaimed British crime series Cracker. So he's ideally cast in this deft mix of spoof and real blood-curdling horror. The plot - if you can call it one - revolves around the notorious monster hunter Van Helsing,played by rising Australian star Hugh Jackman. Being a Melbourne-based entertainment writer, I was familiar with Jackson's pre-Tinsel Town work. He first showed his star quality in an Australian TV prison drama Correlli where he played an inmate who had an affair with a female warder. It wasn't long before Hollywood beckoned the gifted young actor. I have a gut feeling that director Sommers told Jackman to adopt fellow Aussie actor Mel Gibson's transpacific accent. Because he sounds remarkably like Mel in places. The writer/director also has Van Helsing wear an Australian bush ranger's hat! A private joke between him and Jackman?! Another top down under thespian Richard Roxburgh co-stars as Count Vladislaus Dracula. What a superb performance,too. Roxburgh plays it dead straight - and there are some really spine-chilling moments. In fact,when the dark menace of Vlad appears, it's a scream a minute...as he stakes out his victims. He unleashes some truly horrible creatures-including the sexy lycra-clad Harpies,who are very lustful,vengeful ladies indeed (!) - and those terrifying teeth-baring,blood-drooling were-wolves. Stunning British actress Kate Beckinsale is the truculent Transylvanian Gypsy Princess Anna who attracts the attention of Van Helsing - and Dracula. Van Helsing's intentions towards the heroine are honorable - but the salacious Count only wants to sink his fangs into Anna's pristine white neck. The special effects creators have done a brilliant job on what I would think wasn't a massive budget. You can almost hear the studio props creak! Today's savvy film-goers want their special effects to surround-sound them out of their seats. But,nevertheless,director Sommers shows plenty of flair and I'm sure we'll be seeing a lot more of his product-with bigger budgets-in the future. Meanwhile, it was great just to sit back and enjoy a cleverly-made movie.

Review title: A shining beacon for fantasy adventure films
Review_body: This is one of those movies that separate the movie lovers from the trolls and the bandwagon zombies. This movie has everything a good fantasy adventure needs: exciting action scenes, amazingly lovable franchise-worthy characters, amazing soundtrack, great costumes, great humor, a cool story and an AMAZING ending. Sure it has some flaws, but they are minor. If this movie was grittier and held on more tightly to the many moral and philosophical themes it touches upon for just a moment, it would have been the greatest monster hunter movie ever made. But even as it is, it is still one of the greatest. I am a lifelong fan of fantasy and have probably seen every movie in the genre and i can say that, in a sea of films that try to cash in on established characters by trying to do needless and terrible''reboots'', or films that are all but mediocre, this movie shines true as an example of how fantasy adventure films should be made. It will forever be one of those films that should have had many sequels.

Having watched the film (more than once)i must say that i think that the person who wrote the comment "A Stupid and Extremely Disappointing Movie" is being silghtly childish. You cannot watch a film like Van Helsing with out taking it with a pinch of salt - it is a movie with vampires, werewolves and the frankenstine monster in at all at once for goodness sake. So you cannot go in to it thinking in a literal sense. You have to accept that it is not going to be some ground breaking epic and that it is just a bit of fun - but at the end of the day that doesn't matter, because if you go in with the right attitude and you enjoy it, then what does it matter that it is a bit "off" in places. I thoroughly enjoyed the film and would definitely recommend it to any one who likes action/fantasy films and is up for a bit of fun!

Terrible acting. Terrible accents. Terrible costumes. Terrible wigs. Terrible writing. The only thing that redeemed this movie at all was that Hugh Jackman did a decent job as Van Helsing (though I still think there's quite a bit of room for improvement) and the fact that it's an interesting concept and attempts to pay homage to the oldschool horror films, which is very cool. If somebody had gotten ahold of the script and filled in the plot holes, tamed the random wit, and given the movie some purpose... then it could've been great. Well, they would've had to fire 90% of the cast too (particularly Kate Beckinsale and whoever it was that played Dracula)... AND the costume designer.

Review title: Van Helsing should go down in history as one of the greatest movies of all time!
Review_body: From the moment the movie started i knew it was soon to be my favourite. From the moment it begins to the moment it ends, the action never stops. From fighting a cross between the hunchback of notre-dame in Paris, to fighting count Dracula in his castle. I was astounded by how well the opening scene was choreographed with state of the art, special affects from the word go. there is never a glum moment, whether its Anna Valerious (KATE BECKINSALE) sprinting through the woods trying to escape from a CGI werewolf of its Van Helsing (HUGH JACKMAN) trying to shoot down three of Dracula's hideous air-born vampire wives with his mechanical bow and arrow in Transylvania. There are also many other astounding action scenes including, Anna's (Kate Beckinsale)brother turned into a werewolf after getting bitten by another while trying to save Anna, Count Dracula (RICHARD ROXBURGH, excellent acting) or the one, the only, Frankinstein's monster! You may be thinking its going to be trashy (stupid action constantly with no story) but you would be wrong. Van Helsing is sent to Transelvania to end the curse of the Valerious family by killing Dracula. Overall, Stephen Sommers (THE MUMMY, THE MUMMY RETURNS) has exceeded even his two previous blockbuster titles. I give Van Helsing a rating of 10. I have also received information that there will soon be a Van Helsing 2. (CAN'T WAIT!)
My only comment is, that, since we recently visited Romania, we know that the nearest major city is not BUDAPEST, which is in Hungary, but Bucharest its capital.

I think that this is an all-around great movie for several reasons. 1. Considering that there wasn't a huge amount of money spent on the movie, they did really well with what they had. 2. The acting is great. I like Hugh Jackman as an actor and I think that he molded right into the part of Van Helsing. Kate Beckinsale always impresses me with her acting and I hope to see her in more movies in the future. I see that she has just completed another one and is working on another now. Wonderful! Keep it up, Kate! 3. The actors appeared to be having a great time making the movie. and the kind of wry humor that showed up throughout the movie - whether intentional or not - made it a fun movie to watch. The humor also made it easier to connect with the characters and use my imagination more to sympathize with the heroes of the movie. 5. The special effects and stunts were great! I imagined what the filming must have been like. I am greatly impressed with the actors' ability to perform around the combination of technologies that were used to accomplish the movie. There were many elements that, in imagining myself in their shoes, would have distracted me. Seeing this kind of work by actors helps me to appreciate what they do even more. 6. I thought the extras on the DVD were good and the commentaries by the director/producer and actors were good too. The commentaries add a lot to the movie and make it an even richer experience.

I have no idea where all these people are coming from that hate Van Helsing. There is not one bad thing that I can say about Van Helsing. Its funny, thrilling and parts of it are horror. What's not to love about a spoof of Dracula, the Wolfman and Frankinstein? With a little Mr. Hyde action in the beginning. To those of you who love/like this movie.... THANK YOU! To those who don't..... ARE YOU INSANE?! And to those who never saw it..... its a great movie to watch on a rainy day with a bunch of friends with a big big bowl of popcorn. I'll be honest and say that I have seen this movie over 15 times and it never gets old and I still crack up... don't get the wrong idea thinking that its a comedy... cause it's not. I laughed when the guy in Blade 3 was on fire and in American Werewolf in London when the guy was being torn to shreds. I don't know why, but people dieing in movies makes me laugh. This is a must see movie. Go to Hollywood Video or Circuit City and buy it... its only like 15 bucks now, not that bad.

Review title: A camp-action masterpiece - actually, THE camp-action masterpiece
Review_body: When I first saw this film in a theater, I wouldn't have given it more than a 7 - but I liked it enough to buy the video, and on third viewing, 13 years later, I was blown away by its overall excellence: the photography is gorgeous, the plot original, the script first rate, the acting first-rate, the music rich and strong without ever overpowering the movie itself, and the combination of camp humor, action, and an unexpected ending (spoiler alert) make it for me one of my all-time favorite movies. If you like a mixture of humor and action, with spectacular photography and a rich score, this is for you. While The Mummy is okay, Van Helsing is far more original and well-done in every aspect - a camp action masterpiece. Much better than 90 percent of the movies I have seen in the last decade.

It continued to drag and drag and I was getting very bored. Lucky I had bought some food and drink ( seen as I was at the cinema) this kept me occupied, until it ran out. Then I had to pay attention. What I saw wasn't very amazing from what I can remember these deformed angel type things were after him. After a few hours I went to get a sweet from my pick n mix bag I looked up and saw that he had turned into a werewolf! I was just like where the heck did that come from?? so tip from me if your dumb enough to watch this rubbish make sure you pay 100% attention to it.

I personally love this kind of tongue-in-cheek, change of the usual film. League of Extraordinary Gentlemen was that, as was Sky Captain and the World of Tomorrow. If people looked at them more as just visually entertaining with a bunch of sharp one-liners, and tried to stop making them the next big action movie, or trying to read a life change message somewhere in there, they'd have more fun! I loved the real mix of actors appearing in this movie - I was straight to IMDb after watching it to see if I was right or wrong about who played who. I especially liked the straight-in beginning - no credit break to kill the run of the film. The black-and-white beginning, going to colour soon after, was not new, but echoed nicely with the old Hollywood movies that the start was echoing. Altogether, a great fun watch. But that's just me!

This movie is absolutely absurd. The plot is ridiculous and convoluted. It substitutes a legitimate storyline with copious amounts of CGI, poorly rendered CGI at that. Hugh Jackman was doing well with X-Men, and then someone slipped him some acid and he decided to do this movie. It's one of those films where the only possible way to justify it is to assume that the filmmakers were not taking the movie seriously, that they intended it to be a campy farce of the classic Gothic heroes/characters. And however much I try to tell myself this, I really think the producers made this movie with the utmost sincerity, which is just depressing. If you're a fan of Hugh Jackman, or even Kate Beckinsale, please, for the love of Dracula, stay away from "Van Helsing".

The casts awful 'Transylvannian accents' (all of them slightly different, by the way), did it for me after 13 minutes - and I was weaned on Hammer Horror films!If you can get past that, then some reviews suggest it may be worth sticking with, perhaps? Review title: There are few films wore than this
Review_body: I went into Van Helsing expecting an entertaining but slightly silly movie. Something along the lines of the Mummy, funny, exciting, a bit silly, with a decent plot and great action. Instead what I got was one of the worst films ever made. The plot makes no sense. It seems like the main goal of the movie was to throw as many fictional horror creatures into a CGI mix as possible without violating any copy rights. The plot is weak, the acting is poor, the lines are horrendous. The CGI effects are well done - but this isn't the first time someone has done good CGI. Good CGI is expected for a big budget film made in 2004. Plot matters, acting matters, writing matters, and this movie falls short in so many respects that audiences should be paid back for the time they wasted watching this movie.

Review title: Just stupid, and I usually enjoy films such as this...
Review_body: When this movie started with the black & white intro scene, I thought, "Hmm...I wonder why they're doing a parody of old horror movies, what with the cheesy accents and clichéd dialog." Then, to my horror, I realized that the director was SERIOUS about this pile of stuff.Again, I enjoy action/horror/science fiction movies, but my goodness...The CGI was laughable and completely unbelievable. I know it's flying vampires, Mr. Hyde, etc., but come on, make it look somewhat real! The ridiculousness of the dialog was only amplified by the unintentionally hilarious accents.I want those two hours of my life back.

I would not recommend seeing this movie if you are going to the theaters to be entranced by a deep plot and characters that you can relate to. This movie is strictly for the 14 year old comic book lovers. I am myself a 14 year old lover of comics, but I also like a good story to go along with the special effects. Several lines in the movie got on my nerves i.e. (Lady Vampire as she terrorizes the villagers, taunting them in an idiotic fake Transylvanian accent) "...Too bad, so sad..." and "...Do you like to fly?..." This is set in Transylvania in the 1800's. I don't believe they used that type of slang. Like I said if you are a fan of badly written, physically impossible, and entirely visual comic and/or movies this movie is for you, otherwise don' see this movie.

Oh my gosh... Used to sneak past my sleeping parents to watch the vampire/Frankenstein/werewolf horror flicks of old. Saw the 1994 horror remake of Dracula with good acting but did not bring the joy of watching these type of films to my heart. Now I must admit Hugh Jackman (in "Swordfish") and Kate Beckinsale (in "Aviator")can do no wrong in my eyes and you both are such beautiful people. Their acting did not appear as acting. Played Anna and Van Helsing as if they were these characters. Richard Roxbaugh was such a surprise as Dracula. Brought this highly intelligent, selfish, and a bit curious creature to real life. Oh and Carl! I had no idea you were in "The Lord of the Rings." Wonderful performance David..:) Do love the style of Stephen Summer's movies and soundtracks. Will be curious on his remake of "Flash Gordon" though. Queen's soundtrack will be hard to beat Stephen.... So, needless to say, but will say "Van Helsing" was pure enjoyment to my eyes, ears, and heart.. Thank you so much to all of you involved in the making of this film... Hollywood cannot improve on "Van Helsing."
